pages.title: Path Components
pages.text:
Paths consist of 3 parts; an Input Nest, Markers and an Output Nest.
Input Nests, which have a queen, are nests where the Worker Ants will originate from.
Markers are points, placed in the world, which the Worker Ants will follow.
Output Nests, which have no queen, are nests which Worker Ants will deposit items into.

pages.title: Path Components
pages.text: A Worker Ant will not pathfind to an Ant Nest with a Queen.

$(l:antsportation:blocks/ant_nest)Ant Nests$() are the storage interfaces for the path network.

Firstly, place down an $(l:antsportation:blocks/ant_nest)Ant Nest with an $(l:antsportation:blocks/ant_hill)Ant Hill on top of it.

You can input or output items into the Nest, not the Hill, from any side except the top.
Only the Ant Nest immediately below the Ant Hill will be considered part of the network.
pages.title: Input & Output
Input & Output
pages.text: Note: Ants carry any item in the <gold>antsportation:ant_transportable</> tag.

pages.title: Setting up a path
pages.text:
To set up a path for your Worker Ants to follow you have to use $(l:antsportation:blocks/marker)Markers$().

Place a marker down once every 8-10 blocks (Any lower is less reliable).

You can also place the markers on the sides of blocks to have them climb up walls like spiders!
(Don't make the path too small, because they might fall off).

pages.title: Setting up a path
pages.text:
Make sure that the distance between any Ant Hill and marker block is more than 3 blocks, else, ants might get stuck.

Note: If you prefer to transport items without boxes, a $(l:antsportation:mechanics/config)config$() option is available

pages.title: Splitting
pages.text:
Since markers can be dyed, it's possible to split a path into 2.

Place 2 differently dyed markers adjacent to the marker you want to split.

If you want to split a colored marker for an additional time, you first have to merge it with a default coloured marker.

pages.title: Splitting
pages.text: Make sure that the 2 branching colours are opposite of each other. No diagonals!

pages.title: Merging
pages.text:
When there is no colored marker within a 10 block radius, the Worker Ant will instead try to pathfind to a default coloured marker.

Multiple coloured paths will merge into a single default coloured path.
